solution_line_template: Isabela bought twice as many cucumbers as pencils, meaning she bought {cucumbers_bought}/{cucumbers_to_pencils_ratio} = <<{cucumbers_bought}/{cucumbers_to_pencils_ratio}={pencils_bought}>>{pencils_bought} pencils.
The total cost for purchasing the pencils without the discount is {pencils_bought}*${cost_per_item} = $<<{pencils_bought}*{cost_per_item}={pencils_cost_no_discount}>>{pencils_cost_no_discount}

The total amount of money she used to buy the pencils is ${pencils_cost_no_discount}-${discount_amount} = $<<{pencils_cost_no_discount}-{discount_amount}={pencils_cost_with_discount}>>{pencils_cost_with_discount}
She also bought the cucumbers at a total cost of ${cost_per_item}*{cucumbers_bought}=$<<{cost_per_item}*{cucumbers_bought}={cucumbers_total_cost}>>{cucumbers_total_cost}
The total cost for the items is ${cucumbers_total_cost}+${pencils_cost_with_discount}= $<<{cucumbers_total_cost}+{pencils_cost_with_discount}={total_cost}>>{total_cost}
